name: Advanced Medical & Healthcare Terminology
description: Comprehensive medical vocabulary for healthcare professionals, advanced anatomy, pathophysiology, and clinical practice.
context: advanced medical practice, pathophysiology, clinical diagnosis, and healthcare systems

words.meaning: the study of functional changes in the body associated with disease
the causation or origination of a disease or pathological condition
the likely course and outcome of a disease or medical condition
systematic method to identify possible diseases that could account for symptoms
specific situation in which a drug or procedure should not be used
study of how the body absorbs, distributes, metabolizes, and excretes drugs
study of biochemical and physiological effects of drugs on the body
medical specialty concerned with pain relief and total care during surgery
relating to both the heart and lungs and their coordinated function
branch of medicine dealing with disorders of the endocrine system
branch of medicine focused on digestive system and its disorders
branch of medicine concerning blood, blood-forming organs, and blood diseases
state in which immune system's ability to fight disease is compromised
specialty of medicine and pediatrics dealing with kidneys
branch of medicine dealing with prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer
branch of medicine dealing with musculoskeletal system disorders
medical specialty dealing with diseases involving respiratory tract
medical specialty dealing with rheumatic diseases affecting joints and tissues
branch of medicine dealing with skin, nails, hair, and related diseases
branch of medicine dealing with disorders of the nervous system
medical specialty devoted to diagnosis and treatment of mental disorders
medical discipline using medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases
study of distribution and determinants of health-related events in populations
action taken to prevent disease, especially by specified means or agents
relating to healing or curing disease; having healing properties
relieving pain or alleviating symptoms without dealing with underlying cause
persisting for long time or constantly recurring medical condition
sudden onset or short course; requiring urgent medical attention
not harmful in effect; specifically referring to non-cancerous tumors
very virulent or infectious; cancerous and spreading rapidly
development of secondary malignant growths distant from primary cancer site
temporary or permanent decrease or disappearance of disease signs
process of helping patient recover maximum functional ability after illness
process by which person becomes protected against disease through vaccination
tendency of biological systems to maintain stable internal environment
